title: Average Price of Homes: T Procedures
question_text:
A realtor is interested in the average price of homes in his state. He randomly selects $16\text{ homes}$ and records the prices.
Under what conditions could $T$ procedures be safely used in this situation?

choices.text:
As long as the sample is larger, say over
30
,
T
procedures could be used in this case.

T
procedures can be used only if the problem states that the parent population is approximately normal.

T
procedures cannot be used in this situation as it would be more appropriate to use
Z
procedures.

T
procedures can be used in this situation as is.

T
procedures can be used in this situation as long as a graph of the data shows no strong skewness or outliers.
